file_content.text: Uh huh.
Whatever you're planning, forget it.
What? I'm not up to anything... at the moment.
Following you around isn't so bad. You visit the most extravagant locales.
Those Girards had some lovely finery just collecting dust.
I picked up a little souvenir from the Royal Museum.
I thought we could make sure these get put to better use.
Keep your loot. I work for a living.
I don't need handouts.
Fine, I wanted some decorations anyway. Brighten up the cell, you know.
You're giving me something worth money?
What are you trying to pull?
Gesture of good faith and all that. Figured if I'm stuck here, I might as well lighten the mood.
Glad to see you're actually making yourself useful.
I like the way you think.
A little respect might be nice. I was a target in the Great Hunt, you know.
Unless we find a collector, we'll need to fence these. Quick turnaround'll forfeit a big cut, but it'll be a nice bonus.
Let's just see the credits.
Quick is fine.
I'd rather get the most bang for my buck. Throw 'em in cargo.
Let's hold out for a bit.
Works for me. Try not to take too many sharp turns.
I've got better things to do than haggle in pawn shops.
You handle it.
I'll see what I can do.
I have to say that none of my trips to Alderaan have ever been quite so... explosive.
So, this is home. A little spare, don't you think?
It serves well enough.
It's a tool.
You're practical. I get it. I'm not suggesting plating the hull in gold.
What did you expect?
Thought I'd have more dancing girls?
Now there's a thought.
Thought I'd have frilly curtains?
Well, now that you mention it....
I'm just saying, maybe you should consider conserving ammo and installing seats with upholstery.
Blame the previous owner.
I'll give you that.
Found yourself a fixer-upper, huh?
She's not bad, just needs a little TLC. A couple bounties ought to go a long way to sprucing the place up.
Think about it.
Keep the place clean and we'll talk.
I'll consider it.
I guess I can live with it, for now.
Couldn't hurt to make this bucket a little more livable.
You make a good point.
I can recommend some folks who keep a good selection of "before market" parts. So's not to strain your budget.
I've got better things to spend my credits on than your comfort.
Fat chance.
I forget you legit types are always strapped for cash.
We can't all be fabulously wealthy criminal masterminds, but this bounty hunting gig seems straightforward enough.
Besides, I like the idea of doing the chasing for a change... even if I am slumming it.
You're not going to believe this. I heard from Hylo.
She's willing to take me back, if I'm willing to show she means more to me than me.
Sent the message certified, credits on delivery. Almost cleaned me out just to have it delivered.
She's nobody's fool.
Clever girl.
Never was. If it'd been my plan to steal the money, she'd have sniffed me out. That just sort of... happened. I learned my lesson.
I hope you get her back, she's my kind of lady.
I like her.
One-of-a-kind. Too bad it took me this long to figure it out.
You've still got a lot of catching up to do.
That's getting off easy.
I know, I know, but I'm up to it.
I feel like I'm back in my prime. Not that I'd slipped, I'm just... unburdened.
I owe you for that, so I thought I'd say it. Don't go making a big deal out of it.
Never.
That won't be a problem.
Glad I could help. Really.
You're welcome.
That's going on the record.
It is a big deal.
I'm going to hear about this for a while, aren't I?
I've got to hand it to you, you really surprised me. You're not what I would call a conventional partner in crime.
But we're really turning out to make quite the team.
Letting you live was one of my better decisions.
Couldn't agree more.
I do think it's because we got all that pesky trying-to-kill-each-other out of the way early.
That mean I'm stuck with you?
I'm valuable, what can I say?
I'm afraid so.
You just needed someone who could pick up all your slack.
More or less.
Can you argue with the results?
You and me, we're going to carve out a criminal empire, or at least accumulate one heck of a fortune. Your children's children won't know what to do with it.
I'm telling you, Wild Space is the limit!
When did you get back?
Oh, a little while ago. I wasn't exactly in a talkative mood. My little pipe dream involving Hylo went about as you'd have expected.
Didn't find her?
Wild ghost chase?
No, I found her.
I'm here, if you want to get it off your chest.
What about now?
I'm not exactly used to spilling my guts, but okay.
I expected you wouldn't make it back.
No, you're still breathing.
I appreciate the vote of confidence.
After all these years I finally caught up with her and she hadn't changed a bit.
I found her on Belsavis, in some sort of stasis chamber. It was like I'd just left.
She wasn't in a forgiving mood.
The wounds were still fresh.
At least she didn't have time to nurse an old grudge.
Maybe that was for the best.
Yeah... yeah, maybe. Regardless, it wasn't pretty.
Talk about your past catching up with you.
Weird.
If she'd had a blaster, she'd have shot me the moment she came to. Lucky for me, she recognized that prison wasn't the place to hash things out.
She took off the first chance she got. Hardly the reunion I was looking for, but I got her out of that pit. That counts for something, right?
I'm not the one to ask.
Maybe.
Guess I'm stuck answering that one myself.
She'd have been stuck down there forever if you hadn't.
I think so.
She deserved better than that.
Hey, who needs love anyway... thanks.
Well, now you can get over it and move on.
It's closure.
Yeah, maybe.
If you'll excuse me, I need to create a hangover to nurse.
I caught up with that old associate from the blockade run.
Old Quan and I had a nice little chat; he was surprised to see me, to say the least.
Did he know anything useful?
And?
Can you trust him to keep quiet about your new identity?
He recognized you?
Oh, I'd say he'll remain mum on the subject indefinitely. Don't give me that look, I bought his last round.
He probably thought he was finally rid of you.
Disappointed, more like.
We were never that close, not like you and me, so I didn't mind too much having to shoot him.
Before I had to end Quan's retirement prematurely, I convinced him to fill me in on some gaps in our history since the blockade run.
When the Hutts came looking for their return investment, Hylo Visz smuggled herself off to Republic space with the help of another free trader.
That doesn't exactly narrow it down.
You know where?
More than you think. I know the guy.
Technically, so do you.
That definitely increases her odds of being alive.
Good news, right?
I'm not so sure, given where she was headed.
Looks like she got over you quickly enough.
Bet it was a new beau.
Ha ha, fat chance. Hylo had better taste in who to be caught dead with.
Remember Zale Barrows? She cut a deal with that twerp to hide her on Belsavis!
A goody two-shoes who threw in with the Republic as a privateer after the blockade, he took her off to some prison colony far off the radar.
If she's still stuck there, this is my chance to swoop in to the rescue. I've got to go after her.
It seems like you owe her a lot more than that, but it's a start.
I suppose so.
If it means this much to you, count me in.
Need help?
This is personal, too personal. I've got to take care of this on my own.
You're deluding yourself. All that time running make you forget how to face consequences?
Listen to what you're saying.
I'm suggesting risking my neck on the off chance I can save someone who hates my guts. Of course I'm deluded.
If I don't make it, well--thanks. I don't think Tyresius would have ever gotten this opportunity.
So what do you know about Hylo Visz?
Who or what is Hylo Visz?
Nothing.
Only the big-time celebrity who coordinated the biggest blockade run this galaxy's ever seen.
I've heard the name. She was some big-time spacer, wasn't she?
Sounds familiar.
You could put it that way, if you're partial to understatement.
I know that you don't really care what I know.
Just skip to the point.
She broke the Mandalorian blockade at the Hydian Way. You know, the one that strangled Coruscant and dashed a full-scale Jedi assault.
And it wasn't out of the goodness of her heart, either. Credits were involved, a lot of them.
Go on.
I like her already.
My kind of woman.
She was quite the lady.
You could say that run was the height of her career, but that's only because she dropped off the scanners not long after.
She single?
My kind of woman.
I heard that!
No. She's dead. According to the rumors anyway.
I bet more than a few people would be willing to pay to have a word with her.
Could be a nice bounty.
That'd be difficult to deliver, considering she's dead. Anyone asking about Hylo isn't looking for a chat.
Most think the Hutts were behind Hylo's disappearance, but anyone who knew her could tell you they'd have better odds winning a marathon.
No, she's still out there... somewhere.
Why the sudden interest in a long lost spacer?
Where's this going?
Never took you for the type to get starstruck.
You really admire her.
What? No. We've got history.
Not to mention her credits.
So's that fortune.
Ah, that isn't exactly the case.
Hylo was my old partner... more than that. That blockade run was the last thing we ever did together. Like I said, a lot of credits were involved.
When I saw the opportunity, I took off and left Hylo holding the bag. Stupid.
Reassuring.
Sounds just like you.
Hey, I said it was stupid. I learned my lesson.
You double-crossed your own girlfriend?
That's really low.
Technically, she wasn't my girlfriend when I double-crossed her....
I was young and naive... and maybe a little afraid of commitment. I didn't know what I lost until it was gone.
Is that a conscience showing?
You're actually sorry?
I don't know, maybe. It was a dumb move I regret making.
Listen, I found out that an old associate from that blockade run is still around and kicking. A mutual acquaintance.
I owe Hylo one last visit. If he knows where she's been laying low all this time, I've got to track him down.
Notice anything different?
About you? Can't say I do.
No.
Good! Money well-spent.
Are you gonna get upset if I say "no"?
This a trick question?
Hardly. I'll just chalk it up to fine craftsmanship.
You should lay off the junk food.
Weight gain, for one.
And they said this stuff was slimming.
Just acquired some nice form-fitting blast armor. Thought I'd see if it would stand up to a trained eye.
Apparently so, if your "observation" is any indication.
Glad that worked out for you.
Well, good, I suppose.
The equipment I'm providing not cutting it?
Don't like my gear?
No complaints. This is purely supplemental.
Be happy to see if it stands up to my blaster.
Why stop the experiment there?
I can always count on you to keep my welfare in mind.
Since I'm still putting myself in harm's way, I decided to make a little investment in my well-being.
Been stocking up on interesting tidbits at every port we've hit. From here on, I'm ready for anything.
Meet our new product. Had our salt shipment bottled as "special" tablets to help organics retain water.
Now we just need to seal the deal. I want you with me when our prospective buyer calls. Keep him from getting too comfortable.
We'll be meeting an Arcona named Groona to convince him to act as our supplier to the colony.
Sounds simple enough.
Understood.
I thought you were going to be the supplier.
Why?
Unless you want to start making regular trips to the middle of nowhere, we need a middleman.
I'll try not to let all the excitement get to me.
Sounds dull.
You'll change your tune when the credits start rolling in.
This chump would do anything for enough credits to get off Tatooine. I don't think it'll take much to get poor Groona to bite.
Groona, good to hear from you. Looking well. Lose some weight?
Oh, her? Don't worry about her. Had to let my last security detail go in favor of this fine lady. Say hello, my dear.
Oh, him? Never mind him. Had to let go of my last security detail in favor of this one. Consummate professional. Say hello.
Hello.
Fine.
We look forward to doing business with you, Groona.
The pleasure is mine.
See, a perfect lady.
See, a perfect gentleman.
Manners aren't part of the job description, you understand.
You know, Groona, I'm a bit of a philanthropist. Did I mention that?
My visit to Tatooine left me inspired by the plight of rugged folks like yourself trying to squeeze life out of that dust bowl.
Make life easier for the little guy, that's my motto. And helping you hardworking souls is now my personal mission.
I'm sure he's more interested in hearing about the product.
Just get to the deal.
Who wouldn't be?
He'll put himself in the poor house if that's what it takes.
My boss is a true saint.
My associate worries too much; my friend Groona and his pals wouldn't leave me holding the bag. There'll be plenty of prosperity to go 'round.
Ahem. Sorry, dry air.
What a load of garbage.
So, as I was saying.
The top chemists at Roing Industries developed this little wonder for us: a compound designed to maximize water retention in organic life-forms.
The benefit to hardworking subsistence farmers such as yourself is immeasurable.
Can you be sure you'll ever be able to afford that at the rate you're going?
That's why you need us.
We're helping you use less water, leaving you more to sell. It'll pay for itself several times over.
You're in a good position, Groona. You stand to make a lot of money as my distributor once things take off.
We've invested a lot of money into this project for you, now you're not interested?
You're starting to annoy me.
That's a better plan for your savings than investing in this garbage.
Hang on to your credits.
This is lower than I'm willing to sink, Gault.
Must be having some kind of flashback. Can't find decent help these days. Just, let me handle my associate and we'll finish our business.
Snap out of it, buddy. It's Gellar, Gellar Roing, your boss. Don't mess this up.
We're better than this.
There are wealthier marks.
And I thought you might be too ruthless for this business.
Need me to remind you who's boss?
Don't tell me what to do.
Oh, ease off. If it means that much to you....
I can't even begin to express my disappointment.
Looks like I'm sending you the whole shipment. Free of charge. Choke on it.
Well, since we both know how sensitive you are about robbing the poor, let me remind you of the benefits of robbing the rich.
Just so we're clear, me talking to you doesn't mean I'm not still irked about that last job.
You didn't lose much on it.
You can't be that mad.
Yeah, yeah, I said I was irked, not that I was going to steal your firstborn.
I know it was your deal, but I couldn't go through with that. Maybe next time.
I'm sorry.
I'm surprised you're open to a next time after that little show.
Getting the silent treatment from you would be a blessing.
Like I care.
Watch it, or I'll start practicing my singing.
I think it's fair to say you owe me another go. And not just anything--I'm talking about a big score.
I'm sure I can think of something that won't upset your precious sensibilities.
Sorry, I'm feeling a little sick to my stomach.
Fine, just hurry up.
We had a long trip, my partner's just a little grouchy. No need to rush a decision. I stand by my product.
Tell you what, I'll send you a sample. If your friends aren't begging you for more in a matter of days, you can keep it. No charge.
Don't mention it. I hope we'll be hearing from you soon.
Come on, partner, I have a feeling we'll need to increase our supply.
See, I told you a little patience goes a long way, but let me remove any lingering doubts.
You remember those little trinkets that happened to come into our possession on Alderaan?
I managed to sell most of the stuff right back to the nobility, at a tidy profit.
How'd you swing that?
You're kidding.
It took a little laundering, but the Alderaanians were very eager to outbid the competition.
You did the work, you get the spoils.
I want you to keep it.
Very generous of you. Very foolish, but very generous... thanks.
This had better be worth the wait.
That was ages ago.
You want to try to squeeze more out of those stuffed shirts, be my guest. Alderaan's not going anywhere.
Now we wait for Groona gets his friends hooked and watch the credits trickle in.
I have to hand it to you, you were right.
Excellent.
Of course I was right. I didn't get to be the infamous Tyresius Lokai by placing sucker bets.
I thought you were crazy when you pitched this little scheme.
I can't believe this worked.
I'm unconventional, not a crackpot. Remember that.
I've got blood money that's cleaner than these credits.
I've never stooped so low.
Hey, you've taken credits from some pretty dirty hands in the past, friend.
You seem to have a knack for this line of work. I think it's time we take off the kid gloves and find a big score.
I'll do a little legwork while you find ways to spend your newfound wealth.
Remember those Arcona colonists I was telling you about?
Well, I've got the perfect racket to skim a little profit off of those moisture farming saps: salt.
As in table salt?
Salt?
Well, I'm not talking bath salts, considering water's a luxury good. Listen, I've got a theory.
This I have to hear.
Do tell.
You can stop there.
Forget it.
Hey, hey, hey, hear me out.
I used to know this spacey Arconan bagman back on Nar Shaddaa. Thought the guy was a spicehead for the longest time.
Turns out I was only half-right. This guy's cravings were something else.
Your friend had some sort of reaction.
Salt.
Can't say for certain, but I've got my suspicions.
Are all Arcona this screwy?
You're not making this up?
The few I have met haven't exactly instilled me with confidence.
Now who are you trying to con?
Do I look that gullible?
If you'd been there, you wouldn't be giving me that look.
One night, after making our handoff in some dive diner, he orders some garbage soup and dumps an entire shaker of salt into the bowl.
Shoulda seen the way this guy went at the stuff before stumbling out of the place like it's last call.
Your money's on these colonists having the same craving.
I see where this is going.
Ten-to-one says there's something about salt those wedge-heads can't resist.
So, you want to sell them salt?
I don't see a scam here.
Do we look like two-credit traders?
The only thing that proves is you keep lousy company.
You're an idiot.
Didn't take a genius to see something fishy was going on and I'm a betting man.
We're gonna sell those colonists the answer to all their woes, specially formulated and offered exclusively through Roing Industries.
If I'm right about how much Arcona love the stuff, our biggest problem will be keeping up the supply.
Let me tell you a little thing about opportunity.
Enlighten me.
All right.
Sometimes, when it knocks, you put it away for a rainy day.
What makes you think I need advice on the subject?
I do something wrong?
You're more an "in the moment" type. Sometimes you've got to see the potential farther down the road.
Take this group of "fresh off the shuttle" Arcona I met at the Mos Ila spaceport before you showed up.
I left those Arcona with a stellar impression of Gellar Roing, helpful merchant, and ear-marked them for a return trip once things died down.
What makes them good marks?
How'd they catch your eye?
You know why they were traveling to a dump like Tatooine?
So, you're planning to sell them junk speeders?
I don't follow.
That's small-time, friend. I don't think you fully appreciate the caliber of moron we're dealing with.
What are Arcona?
Arcona?
They're your basic schlubs, big wedge-shaped heads and giant eyes. Can't miss 'em.
How about you just tell me what you want?
I don't need a lecture.
Listen, I met this group of Arcona colonists in Mos Ila while waiting to get off-planet.
Seems fresh water's hard to come by on Cona. These rubes heard about moisture farming on Tatooine and figured it was their ticket to riches.
Fleecing these yokels will be like taking candy from a baby; the key is finding the right scheme.
What are we aiming for?
Any thoughts?
We need something with a low overhead, something we can keep going for a while.
You really enjoy seeing what you can get away with, don't you?
Ah, this is a game to you.
Surely a Mandalorian can appreciate testing one's limits.
I suppose you threw your hat into the Great Hunt out of complacency.
Moisture farmers aren't exactly rolling in credits, but a whole colony of them can add up.
Talk to me when you've got something.
Quit wasting my time.
Some people have no appreciation for the craft.
You'll be pleased to hear I finished fencing those little Alderaanian trinkets that came into our possession.
Made a nice sum, even with the rush.
You're really starting to prove your worth.
Good work.
I'm going to have to teach you a thing or two about compliments and flattery.
Hang onto it, you've earned a little bonus.
I want you to keep it.
Don't mind if I do. It'll complement my modest finder's fee nicely... and, thanks.
You call that a rush? Hand it over.
About time.
Oh, sure. You're welcome. No trouble at all.
Have I mentioned how much pulling that little con has improved my mood?
I think that auction put to bed any lingering doubts that Tyresius is dead and gone.
And aside from knowing my new identity ought to stick, I'd almost forgotten how much I love a good scheme.
Does this mean you're going to stop pacing the ship at all hours?
Back to your old self?
Sure, sure... unless I'm planning our next big score.
Fun and profit, what's not to like?
I see the appeal.
Getting shot at, for one, but working with you has made that pretty common place.
It's not like you were retired when I found you.
It hasn't been that long.
It's hard to work a proper hustle when you're on the run, chum. I've pulled more heists than cons in recent memory.
That was the kind of racket my former partner preferred. Simple, bold, effective. Used to argue about that a lot.
You had other preferences.
It's not your style.
Armed robbery is one of the few things I enjoy in moderation.
How'd you two part ways?
What became of your partner?
We had different ideas about where we were headed... water under the bridge.
Sounds like I got stuck with the dead weight.
Can I swap you out?
Only between your ears.
My preference is to be long gone by the time anyone gets wise. That's a lot easier without bounty hunters breathing down my neck.
It's about time I got back in the game. Can't afford to let myself get out of practice, after all.
What, no parade? Not even a cake? How about at least mustering a "good to see you" for the guy holding your share of the credits?
I take it the auction went to plan?
What's the story?
I don't know whether to be flattered by the numbers.
Sorry to disappoint. Take a drink, instead?
Welcome back.
Well, just this once.
I'd like to see my take before it wanders off.
Show me the money.
It's not like it'd be going far. I live here, remember?
Your cut. Pretty good take considering the expenses. The bidders really couldn't wait to take Tyresius off our hands.
I didn't expect much to come of this.
I should give you more credit.
I know you didn't, which if you'll recall, was my point from the start. You might say I've got some experience duping these suckers.
What expenses?
Expenses?
Middlemen, venues, security, incentives. Everything necessary to ensure a smooth transaction with half the underworld in one place.
Don't let me find you've been holding out on me.
This better be all of it.
Don't worry, you won't. Even if you did, you might think twice about cutting in front of everyone who wants a piece of me.
Three pirate crews, ten free traders, two Exchange bosses, half a dozen Hutts... one I don't even remember crossing. Kept licking his lips, think his name was Drooga.
It was quite the rogue's gallery, lot of familiar faces. Brought back memories, let me tell you.
So, that suggestion I had involving my duplicate. Turns out there are a lot of folks out there who've still got a bone to pick with the late Tyresius Lokai.
A little friendly competition couldn't hurt our final take. I'm thinking an auction would do the trick.
In my experience, auctions and the underworld don't mix well.
That's risky.
Oh sure, get enough bad seeds in one place and something bad's bound to crop up; a little weeding out takes care of that.
I'm open to anything that'll boost our profits.
As long as the price is right.
That's just what I wanted to hear.
Do I look like I have time for that?
Too much of a bother.
No, of course not, but I do.
Give me some time off the ship and I can handle the whole thing by proxy. The only finger you'll have to lift'll be the one accepting your credit transfer.
Make it happen.
All right.
Take as long as you need.
Be careful while you're gone.
Try anything cute and it'll be a two for one sale.
Don't cross me.
Cute's not really my style. Besides, I'm still recovering from the last time we crossed each other.
I'll be back before you know it.
I've been thinking it over and I see a lot of room for improvement maximizing your profits. Take catching me, for example.
Sure you got a nice bounty from the Great Hunt, but why stop there? You just need to use a little imagination.
And what did your imagination come up with?
Let me hear the plan.
This have something to do with your duplicate?
You think I can collect again?
Nothing slips past you, now does it?
Get to the point, Gault.
I'm losing patience with this.
A few words in the right ears and you could make a lot of money on poor Tyresius's remains. If you don't mind double-crossing crime lords.
Offer the body, see who bites, rob them blind. Couldn't be simpler.
Drum up some interest. If the payoff is worth the risk, I'm in.
Let's see where this goes.
See, that's the best part about this little partnership.
Are all of your schemes this blunt?
Suspiciously straightforward.
It's not the most elaborate con, but you're new at this. Besides....
The scams are a lot less risky when you know you can vaporize anyone in the room.
I get dirty enough handling my clients' funny business, thanks.
I'm no thief.
Think of it as just another job. I'm a client with a strong personal interest in seeing Tyresius avenged.
And what better tribute to the late me than ripping off the scum who put me there?
You know, you're pretty quick to sniff out an opportunity for profit.
What's your point?
So?
Just an observation. Makes food for thought.
I like to think I know my business.
Thanks.
Oh, there's no doubt about that.
Flattery won't get whatever you're angling for.
Okay, what do you want now?
If I were really flattering a gem such as yourself, I wouldn't lead with your business acumen.
I was just making an observation, but now that you mention it....
I wonder how much more lucrative our little partnership could be if you applied that intuition to something other than bounty hunting.
Gave up trying to make an honest living already?
Back to your old self, I see.
I was looking for a fresh start with this little arrangement, not a career change.
I'm not opposed to a little moonlighting.
I like lucrative.
Can't afford to keep all your chips at the same table, am I right?
Let me see if I can come up with something that'll play to your strengths, and I'll trust you to recognize a good opportunity when you see one.
Leave me out of your scheming.
Quit trying to con me.
Don't sell our partnership short.
My abundance of skills and expertise are always at your disposal. It just so happens that most of my expertise is in crime.
Mull it over. I'd hate to see so much potential go to waste.
Ahh, it's good to relax. This is as close as I'm getting to it these days.
Everyone has limits.
We all need rest.
Are you kidding? I'm in my prime. I'm talking about trying to unwind here, I mean really unwind. It's... unsettling.
Something wrong?
Problems?
Wrong? Ha. That's putting it lightly. I'm going nuts here!
Could have fooled me.
You're the laziest bum I know.
Laugh all you want, it's hard work, relaxing.
I've spent so long keeping one step ahead of somebody, I can't believe I've lost them for good.
At least when I'm out with you, I usually know where the blaster fire's coming from. Keeps my mind off trouble. Mostly.
The less time you and trouble spend together, the better.
That's good for both of us.
You've got a marvelously camouflaged sense of humor, you know that?
Didn't realize you were having this much trouble adjusting.
I had no idea.
Spend thirty years doing what you're doing and you'll know what I'm talking about.
If you want me to give you more time to loaf around, forget it.
I'm not buying it.
Are you even listening? The last thing I need is more time to myself.
Let's see how easily you brush off your old instincts and catch forty winks after you've spent thirty years bounty hunting.
If you're not up to something, let me know before it becomes a problem.
Keep me informed about this.
Ah, I'm just in a funk.
I knew you were a career scoundrel, but thirty years on the run? Pretty impressive.
Must've been quite a life.
Things weren't so bad, until people finally realized the same guy was responsible for most of their woes.
And I've made some enemies over the years, believe me. Two and a half-dozen Hutt families, the entire Corellian Exchange....
And there was that whole blockade incident that ran the Mandalorians home with their tails between their legs.
You can sleep when you're dead.
No rest for the wicked.
It's so nice to have a partner concerned with my health and well-being.
Come on. I think I've had my fill of all this cheering up.
There's something we should discuss back at the ship.
When things die down, what do you say we take five, huh? I'm feeling a little parched.
Whatever's wrong, it wasn't me.
You know what? Never mind, I think I already know the answer.
Wha--I--um, hello again, Master Roing and um....
[Say nothing]
No, I--
That--that's really impressive, Master Roing, but I don't know if we can afford something that fancy.
Most of us are barely making enough to keep food on the table. We're just trying to save up the credits for passage home.
What's she saying? I don't understand?
What's he saying? I don't understand.
Um, excuse me. Can someone explain what's going on?
I'd do anything to turn things around here, Master Roing. I appreciate the opportunity you're giving us.
Don't look at me, this is your show.
I am clearly not a bad enough influence on you.
You fight, I'll cheer. Deal?
This probably isn't the best time to start bonding.
Don't worry, I'll stick close to you.
Here's where it gets interesting.
After you, I insist.
Guess I'm volunteered now, is that it?
Shouldn't you be, I don't know, collecting a bounty?
I ever tell you you meet the most wonderful people?
